notes.note: This work summarizes my long-term vision on collaborative, systematic and reproducible benchmarking, optimization and co-design of computer systems across all software and hardware layers using public Collective Mind repository of knowledge, common plugin-based auto-tuning framework, big data, predictive analytics (machine learning, data mining, statistical analysis, feature detection), crowdsourcing and collective intelligence
This work extends my previous article [$#cm_29db2248aba45e59_0c44d9a2db3de3c9#$]
Should be publicly available at some point in autumn, 2014
Related Collective Mind infrastructure and repository [$#cm_d76ac3bb9a3f744c_bd5c924415bae775#$]

This work supports my initiative on open research and publication model where all experimental results and related material is continuously shared, validated and improved by the community [$#cm_29db2248aba45e59_40a4b58adfb594a8#$]. To set up an example, I continue sharing all benchmarks, datasets, tools, models and experimental results in Collective Mind repository (c-mind.org/repo)

title: Collective Mind: cleaning up the research and experimentation mess in computer engineering using crowdsourcing, big data and machine learning
